topic.title: The path from Markdown to DITA

section.title: Lists
section.p: Unordered lists like below are automatically converted to DITA lists:
* item
* another item
* one more
You can use both * and - to signal a list item
- sample
- using
- dash
If we already have a list a new item at the end will be added to the existing list
* another item
Ordered lists start with '1.' like below:
1. first Item
1. second item
1. third item
But the actual number after the first one is not really important:
1. first item
4. second item
9. third item

section.title: Quotes
section.p: Below you can see a fragment from [Wikipedia](http://www.wikipedia.org)

section.p: We can handle also `inline code` markup

section.title: Links
section.p: Links are also detected and converted to cross references, like this one:
See the [oXygen website](http://www.oxygenxml.com) for more details.
Or we can have quick links <http://www.oxygenxml.com> and these also can be converted to DITA cross references.
We can combine a link and a list and we have two fixes available, to convert to list and to convert the link to a cross reference:
* See the [oXygen website](http://www.oxygenxml.com) for more details.

section.title: Images
section.p: An image using Markdown format will be converted to a figure or image element, depending whether there is a title or not.
In this case we have a title, so we should get a figure ![oXygen logo](https://www.oxygenxml.com/img/resources/oxygen190x62.png "One of the oXygen logos") which is a block!
In this case we obtain only an image ![oXygen logo](https://www.oxygenxml.com/img/resources/oxygen190x62.png) which is rendered inline.
